CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 15, 1947, pg. 2, reads: "Rug-Making - Council of Jewish Women sponsors the Arts and Crafts instruction at the school for cerebral palsy sufferers on the South Side. Pictured at the loom are students Vincent Monzeluzzo and Patricia Manky. At the wood-working table is little Billy Fernely who is making 'something I guess.' Miss Virginia Perry, grade school teacher, watches her star pupils. Miss Perry first taught children in their own homes and is very proud of the Board of Education for furnishing classrooms for the youngsters. School is under direction of the Medical Department of the Board of Education. Dr. Whittmer is in charge. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Teacher Virginia Perry observing Vincent Monzeluzzo at weaving loom, with Patricia Manky and Billy Fernely, in arts and crafts classroom at school for cerebral palsy sufferers, Bedford School building, Southside
